text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

The topping off
marks the moment when

the very highest beam of the
structure is set in place.

And it represents
roughly the halfway point
of any construction project.

Today, we're here to
celebrate this milestone
for Klarman Hall.

The signed beam becomes a
symbol of our community's shared

stake in it and a permanent
part of the new building.

Behind us you can see
the soaring atrium
and the spacious foyer.

The 1,000 seat
auditorium taking shape.

Beth and I want to thank all the
men and women, steel workers,

crane operators, excavators and
dozens and dozens of others,

for your skilled and
experienced hands

and tireless,
meticulous, hard work
as you build out Klarman Hall.

Beth and I are proud
that Klarman Hall will

be a convening center, bringing
business leaders and guests

from around the world to
interact with HBS students

and faculty for many
decades to come.
What might be convened here?

I'm hoping we'll discuss
the economy of the future,

so that jobs will
continue to be created,

businesses and their
employees will prosper,

and the ensuing economic
growth will lift all boats.
[APPLAUSE]
